thread.title: CSU's Cartwright on midseason Mackey Award watch list
thread.title_full: CSU's Cartwright on midseason Mackey Award watch list

title: CSU's Cartwright on midseason Mackey Award watch list
text:
Colorado State University’s Cartwright on midseason Mackey Award watch list Senior from Pueblo one of 35 players up for award as nation’s outstanding tight end. Post to Facebook Colorado State University’s Cartwright on midseason Mackey Award watch list Senior from Pueblo one of 35 players up for award as nation’s outstanding tight end. Check out this story on coloradoan.com: http://noconow.co/1RJ2qg5 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Kelly Lyell, kellylyell@coloradoan.com 7:19 p.m. MDT October 14, 2015 CSU’s Kivon Cartwright celebrates with teammates after making a touchdown catch in the Rams’ season-opening win over Savannah State. Cartwright was one of 35 players named to the midseason watch list Wednesday for the Mackey Award. (Photo: Ron Chenoy/USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
CSU’s Kivon Cartwright was named to the midseason watch list for the Mackey Award as the nation’s outstanding tight end Wednesday. 
Cartwright, a 6-foot-4-inch, 245-pound senior from Pueblo, has 10 catches for 178 yards and one touchdown for the Rams (2-4, 0-2 Mountain West) entering a home game Saturday against Air Force (3-2, 2-0). 
First-year coach Mike Bobo said before the season that he expected Cartwright to be a key player in the Colorado State University offense. And he said Wednesday that the Rams have tried to get the ball to Cartwright more, but the tight end hasn’t always gotten open or made the catch when the ball has come his way. A pass on the first play of overtime in a loss to the University of Colorado hit Cartwright, who never turned around to look for the ball, in the back of the leg. 
“We’re going to find a way to win the ballgame, and whatever way I feel that can get us that way, and if it’s tight ends, receivers, just running the ball, that’s what we’re going to do,” Bobo said. 
“I think awards happen when you have team success. If you win, then people win awards. If you don’t win, they usually don’t win awards.” 
Cartwright and CSU teammate Steven Walker, an All-Mountain West tight end in 2014 when Cartwright was sidelined with an ankle injury, were both named to the preseason watch list for the Mackey Award. 
Cartwright is one of 35 players on the midseason list. Walker, who has five catches for 72 yards, is not on the list. 
Cartwright has 67 career catches for 1,035 yards and 10 TDs. He also was on the midseason watch list for the award in 2013. 
HIGGINS MISSES PRACTICE: Star receiver Rashard Higgins has missed several days of practice because of an illness, Bobo said. Higgins, a consensus All-American and one of three finalists for the Biletnikoff Award as the nation’s outstanding receiver a year ago, is the Rams’ leading receiver with 34 catches for 469 yards and four touchdowns. 
Bobo said Higgins hasn’t practiced since last Thursday, but receivers coach Alvis Whitted said Wednesday he expects Higgins to play Saturday against Air Force. 
Senior Joe Hansley, the Rams’ second-leading receiver with 15 catches for 197 yards and three touchdowns, missed practice Tuesday with an illness. 
FULL HOUSE? CSU officials are expecting a sellout crowd of more than 32,500 for Saturday’s homecoming game at Hughes Stadium. All seats for the general public sold out last week, prompting the university to put up to 1,000 standing-room only tickets on sale. A handful of those remained Wednesday, as did about 3,000 of the 10,000 tickets set aside for students, a school spokesman said. 
ODDS ARE: Air Force is a 3-point favorite over CSU, according to Las Vegas oddsmakers who post their betting lines at VegasInsider.com. It was listed as a “pick ‘em” game at the beginning of the week, with neither team getting points. 
Follow reporter Kelly Lyell at twitter.com/KellyLyell and facebook.com/KellyLyell.news Read or Share this story: http://noconow.co/1RJ2qg5 TOP VIDEOS
